availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
United States of America.
State of New York
City & County of New York } SS.

I, Joseph B. Nones, having been commissioned on the 25th of October 1861 for 4 years, a Commissioner of Deeds of the state of Kentucky, for New York, by His Excellency Gov. Magoffin, Do Swear, that to the best of my abilities I will honestly, faithfully, truly and Impartially, discharge and perform the duties of such Commissioner, without fear or favor of any one -- according to Law. So help me God.
Subscribed & sworn to before me this 4 day of November 1861.
Official seal & signature of Joseph B. Nones.

figure.ab:
JOSEPH B. NONES
COMMISSIONER
OF
Kentucky
FOR
NEW YORK

body.p:
Commissioner of the state of Kentucky for New York
No. 262 Broadway

Oath of Jos B Nones
Comr of Deeds
Filed Nov. 7. 1861
